main event: A red, elliptical object twice the size of a small bird was observed in the sky over New Bedford, Massachusetts on January 25, 1956.
interesting points: The object changed color from red to very white during the 2.5 minute observation.
The object was seen 15,000 feet above a constable, who was also observed.
The object appeared to be pacing a jet contrail below it.
The object suddenly disappeared into cloud cover.
The sighting was initially categorized as a probable aircraft or balloon sighting.
sighted object: Red, elliptical object twice the size of a small bird
